required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epileptogenic Focus Localization for Children With Epilepsy Using 18F-FDG PET Molecular Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Epileptogenic Focus Localization for Children With Epilepsy Using 18F-FDG PET Molecular Imaging

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study aimed to develop a new approach for automatic localization of epilepsy foci in children with epilepsy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This retrospective study aimed to develop a new approach for automatic localization of epilepsy foci in children with intractable epilepsy.
Pediatric patients with intractable epilepsy would be retrospectively included in this study. The inclusion criteria included (1) age between 6 and 18 y; (2) detailed seizure semiology evaluation, MRI, EEG and interictal 18F-FDG PET/CT examination; (3) clinical diagnosis as focal epilepsy. The exclusion criteria included (a) any history of central nervous system disease; (b) poor image quality due to head movement.

primary_outcome.description: The accuracy of epilepsy focus localization.
The agreement between experiment result and clinical diagnosis.

arm_group.description: Age-matched controls who underwent 18F-FDG PET/CT examination for diseases outside brains.
Children who underwent 18F-FDG PET/MRI to examine extracranial tumors.

study_pop.textblock: 130 pediatric patients with focal epilepsy, 67 age-matched controls, and 37 validation group children.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. age between 6 and 18 years.
- 2. detailed presurgical evaluation, including seizure semiology evaluation, MRI, EEG and interictal 18F-FDG PET/Computer Tomography (CT) examination.
- 3. clinical diagnosis as focal epilepsy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. any history of central nervous system (CNS) disease such as trauma and CNS tumor.
- 2. poor image quality due to head movement.

facility.name: Department of Nuclear Medicine and PET/CT Center, The Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
